intro: Erodium cicutarium, commonly known as bedstraw, is an annual flowering plant native to Europe, Asia, and North Africa. It belongs to the family Geraniaceae and is characterized by its small, pink or white flowers and oval, hairy leaves. The plant typically grows in disturbed soils, such as roadsides and fields, and can reach heights of up to 30 centimeters. Its seeds are dispersed by wind, and it is often considered a weed in agricultural settings. The plant contains compounds that have been used in traditional medicine for their astringent properties.
